ovdesc.p: This application is used to generate outward MT920 (Request statement) which requests to send either 940-Customer statement, 941-Balance report, 942-Interim transaction report or 950-Statement message for the Account maintained at the receiver institution.

This multiple message is sent by an account owner, or a financial institution acting on behalf of an account owner, to an account servicing institution and currently in T24, the outward MT920 is sent without validating the Account and agreement between the parties.

Also same application is used to process incoming MT920, by populating the respective fields in the application with the Incoming tag details and to generate the requested Message.Type. However when an incoming MT920 is received, before generating the required statement, existence of Bilateral agreement for the combination of sender of MT920, Customer of the account as mentioned in the incoming MT920 and Message type request is checked. These agreement details can be maintained in BILATERAL.AGREEMENT application for the Customer & Institution along with the approved Message List.

In case the BILATERAL.AGREEMENT is not available for the above mentioned combination or error such as In valid Account in Incoming MT920 is encountered , a record is created in DE.STATEMENT.REQUEST with status as "IHLD". After adding the BILATERAL.AGREEMENT, statement request can be submitted again or request can be discarded incase the user wishes to handle the request manually.
When a request for 940/950 is received, the applications ADHOC.MESSAGES & ADHOC.STATEMENTS are also updated to avoid duplicate generation of statements during end of day process.
The generated statement's delivery reference is updated back here.

desc.p: Once authorised can not be amended.
Contains the outward delivery reference number of the Account statements(MT941/MT942/MT940/MT950) which is generated in response to this Inward MT920 request.
Request received for Interim statement (941/942) is processed online & this field is updated with the relevant delivery reference.

Account Statements (940/950) are generated as a special statement during End of day process and the delivery reference number is updated here & respective Account record in ACCOUNT.STATEMENT during end of day processing.

Incase a statement is already scheduled for a Message type in frequency 1 (date as given in STMT.FQU.1 field in ACCOUNT.STATEMENT) and an Inward MT920 is processed for the same message type, then statement is generated as per frequency 1 only and delivery reference is updated in ACCOUNT.STATEMENT alone.
This field is updated as "MSG ALREADY SCHEDULED TO BE SENT TODAY" when more than one MT920 request is received with same Message type-either (940/950).

The Outward Message is mapped , formatted and generated using the Carrier & Address as defined for the combination of Customer / Account / Message type in the DE.PRODUCT Application as per the existing Delivery mechanism.
For example, To send Swift Message MT941 for the Accounts related to Dell to Merrill Lynch Bank in response to MT920, following setup is required.
Add a record in DE.ADDRESS for the Customer (1044) & Carrier (Swift ) combination as "MLNYUS33" (Swift address of Correspondent Bank- Merrill Lynch Bank)
DE.PRODUCT should be set to carrier as 'SWIFT' for the Customer(1044) & Message (941) combination.

This field specifies the minimum value (transaction amount) to be reported on the requested message and same is mapped to tag 34F (Floor Limit) in outward MT920.
The amount entered here along with the Currency given in the previous field is mapped to tag 34F for outward MT920 with D/C Marker as as C subject to the following:-

1. When DR.FLOOR.LMT is given as 10000.00, AC.CURRENCY as "USD" & this field is left blank ,then the outward MT920-tag 34F appears as USD10000,00- which indicates all debit or credit transaction exceeds USD10000 has to be reported in the Interim statement.

2. When DR.FLOOR.LMT is given as 10000.00, CR.FLOOR.LMT is given as 15000.00 & AC.CURRENCY as "USD", then in outward MT920-first tag 34F appears as USDD10000,00 & in second tag 34F appears as USDC15000,00 which indicates debit entries in excess of USD10000 & Credit entries in excess of USD15000 has to be reported in the interim statement.
Optional field -When Message.Type is specified as 942 and when XML.STMT.TYPE is defined
